is a device which is used to measure the rate of change of a velocity
now these motion sensors have many advantages one of which is that they are very cheap
you can buy them on aliexpress and easily integrate them to your microcontrollers

now in 2007 resonant acoustic injection frequency was identified as a problem
that causes performance degradation of mems motion sensors it was it was found
by several studies and most mems gyroscope and accelerometers have a unique reason and
frequency that is related to the physical characteristics of the structure
and as a result of this resonance most mems motion sensors generate an unexpected output that may cause the
related system to malfunction in response to sound played at the resonant frequency
now this resonant frequencies are often considered to be commercial secrets however previous studies have already
found that the resonant frequency for mem's gyroscope are somewhere between 8 kilohertz and 28
kilohertz and for mem's accelerometer is somewhere between 2 kilohertz and 13 kilohertz
so an immediate question that arises is how attackers can find or identify the resonant frequency of a motion sensor if
it is not uh already known and basically they need to apply the
following attack which is the resonant acoustic injection frequency attack and first of all they need given a motion

now the next thing that they need to do is to play the signal via speakers in proximity to the motion sensor

seven years ago uh the attack was considered somehow very
impractical and this was because uh back then a smartphone operating

and also the attack vector relied on a very loud speech so basically i consider
this attack seven years ago as impractical however during the last seven years the

an increased understanding regarding this attack vector was gained and the first insight was that mems

and also a second insight that was gained is that the effect of acoustics of motion sensors is increased when the

these two insights somehow increase the practicality of this entire

key logging is the process of recovering the type text or password from data
and various methods will already suggested to create keyloggers now
keylogging is usually done by analyzing data influenced by the side effects of typing for example acoustic data
obtained from microphone can be used to recognize or to identify the keys that are typed
or pressed now if a user wears a smartwatch while typing on a
keyboard we expect the data from the motion sensor
it will expect this data to indicate the movement of the list on the keyboard
however attackers still need to overcome a primary challenge which is the missing
information now assuming that the user wears the smartwatch on his left hand
attackers can only recover the characters on the left side of the keyboard so the characters that were
typed on the right side of the keyboard are missing in the world that they are trying to recover
now various studies have suggested um methods to
fill in the missing gaps and the first stage that they suggested is
attackers can easily detect strokes on the left side of the keyboard by analyzing data from motion sensors
and the next thing uh is that attackers can identify missing strokes on the right side of the
keyboard by analyzing the motion sensor signaling the time domain and by doing so they can
identify gaps and infer the number of missing characters now uh
attackers can use the statistical model to fill in the missing characters using a dictionary and surprisingly this

okay so we are about to uh discuss about the takeaways from this talk and
the first takeaway is that the primary risk that motion sensor currently pose is to individuals privacy rather than
posing a threat to a device security and many people don't consider data from
motion sensors at privacy risk however attackers can derive various insights about users by analyzing motion sensor
data and this can be done for recovering speech for key logging to detect whether an individual is
intoxicated and also is an alternative way to locate a user
without any gps measurement and also for user identification
now currently the most practical way to obtain motion sensor data requires the attacker to install an application on an
iot device in order to obtain motion sensor data
however we expect that ongoing external changes like the adoption of 5g an increased commercial interest in motion
sensor data will result in increased data collection by third parties and as
a result we believe that in the near future obtaining motion sensor data via third parties will become more practical
than installing a malicious application so we believe that the common threat model to obtain motion sensor data is
about to be changed in the near future due to external changes
now another interesting takeaway is that consider our understanding about the privacy risks associated with motion
sensor data we are quite surprised that such data can be obtained without any user
